page.title: 08Churches in the Rawdon area
page.content: In this area there are three parish churches,St.Peter's,St.Margaret's and St.John's;a catholic church St.Josephs ;Trinity Church,a united nonconformist church,and a Kingdom Hall,a Society of Friends meeting room,plus Community and Christian Science churches.Most{ {places of worship}arewell attended. The Society of Friends has been established here since 1697,and used to have both a day/boarding school and an adult school in Rawdon.A small but active group of Quakers meet each week.Early Baptists were baptised in the River Aire and met to worship under{Buckstone Rock}.A commemorative service is held each July under this huge rock. Trinity Church is one of the earliest {local ecumenical projects}in England. Members of the Methodist,Baptist,and United Reform Churches pray together.
